title: TPG DNS servers not connecting to RIOT servers

embed.description: Imgur: The most awesome images on the Internet.

body:
Hi

Since 6/04/2016 our whole household was not able to connect to Riot Servers through the client. All 5 laptops could not open the client with all of them showing the RADs Error report "could not connect to the HTTP servers".

I quickly did research and troubleshooted all computers and my router to make sure it was not a local issue.
Turns out it wasn't.

After trouble shooting, I changed my DNS server from my ISP default server to Google's open dns servers 8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4. Without doubt it worked.
Although we were able to log on to the client again, we received unstable pings. Guessing that it is because we are using a public DNS server. I also performed various ipconfig /flushdns commands and they do not seem to be the issue.

http://imgur.com/a/2dcmo

I am currently using TPG's unlimited data plan which enables me to use various sites like youtube, google, etc. however it is just the riot oce server i cannot connect to.  In addition, i cannot connect to riots webauth webpage as well using my ISP's dns. As of now i am using google's 8.8.8.8 dns to report this issue. However, i can still access other websites with no problem. Everyone in my household is experiencing this issue.

In the link there is a group of photos showing my tracerts to lq.oc1.lol.riotgames.com and chat.oc1.lol.riotgames.com.
I hope that riot quickly resolves this issue between TPG's dns servers and Riot's Servers. 

Currently i have to result to OpenDNS and Google's opendns servers which give me an unstable ping and some packet loss. Latency and packet loss issues did not occur before TPG's dns servers refused to connect to riot's servers.


I hope this issue will be resolved soon

Thanks

replies.body:
For any others who is using TPG, here is what i experienced. I am using TPG as well, found no matter how i just couldn't log into LOL. Been searching for a few websites for the answers. Here is the correct way to solve this issue, i believe it would work 100% for others who is experiencing the same problem. 

{{champion:103}} TPG responded to me by email on how to fix it. It works you should try this to!
~~~~Dear Customer,
Thank you for your email.
I apologise for the delayed response. We recently received high volume of emails and we are doing our best to respond to them in the order that they are received.
To further assist you regarding this matter, please change the MTU on the modem's interface. Here are the steps that you may follow:
Netcomm Wireless
Open a browser and type 192.168.1.1 on the address bar, then press enter
Type admin for the username and password, then click on log in
On the left panel, click on Advance Setup
Under Advance Setup, select WAN Service
Look for MTU size and change it to 1400
Click on Apply/Save
If you are using a 3rd party modem, please refer to the user guide or you may call the manufacturer for assistance! in changing the settings.
After changing the MTU to 1400, reboot your modem, try to log in to League of Legends again and let us know if you need further assistance regarding this matter.
Kind Regards,
Remember, i have TPG so if you guys have slingshot or another internet provider you should try it but i can't 100% guarantee it would work for the other providers.~~~~{{summoner:4}} {{summoner:6}}

Hey there,

I have my doubts that it is Googles DNS that is causing you to have unstable ping and/or high packet loss. It is more than likely an issue in your local network configuration or something on your ISP's end.

Could you do the following for me.

* [Download WinMTR](https://sourceforge.net/projects/winmtr/files/WinMTR-v092.zip/download) and run a traceroute to the following IP. (Allow this to run for 5-15 minutes)
  * 103.240.227.5
* Once adequate time has passed, stop the traceroute, export your results as text.
* Run the [ICSI netalyzr](http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/).
* Post back with a link to your WinMTR results (You can use [pastebin](http://pastebin.com/) for this) and a link to your ICSI netalyzr results.

Hi SephirothSG,

Sorry if I'm not suppose to hijack threads, but I have the exact same problems as Havoczx.
Our TPG DNS servers use to work, however, a couple of months ago they stopped and we started getting the RADS error. We switched over to google dns but we are getting lag spikes every 5-10 minutes. I can't say if google DNS is the problem but i did the tests you recommended and here are the results:

http://pastebin.com/CXQVyXyv

http://n1.netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/summary/id=369839a0-8877-eb1c2ba3-bbfd-4a5e-83d1

Any help would be greatloy appreciated!

Thanks,
Braks

I'd prefer to keep things in separate threads, but that's fine.

Anyway, first thing I notice is some minor packet loss on your ISP's end of things, this is very minor however if the below doesn't help resolve your issue I would suggest contacting your ISP about this.

Let's go over your netalyzr results now, there's a few things so I'll list them off in bullet points.

* You appear to have an excessive packet buffering rate on your connection, please check out [this support article on packet buffering](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq7) and watch the awesome video about it from Player Support.
* Your system doesn't appear to be configured to use Google's DNS servers and is still attempting to resolve using TPG's DNS servers.
* Your system clock appears to be out of sync, check out [this guide](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/6410-clock-synchronize-internet-time-server-windows-10-a.html) on how to sync your clock to an NTP server.

I updated the firmware on the router, double checked all the settings, fixed the clock, and adjusted the MTU to the optimal size.

This is the analysis using Google's DNS:

http://n1.netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/summary/id=369839a0-14240-f87f400f-2720-4252-aec0

Still the same problem with the packet buffering. I had a look at the link you sent and did some further research, but I'm still unsure how to fix it. Would it be best to ask my ISP about it?

WinMTR results using Google DNS:

http://pastebin.com/K0dPFZmE

Packet buffering is usually caused by certain tools running in the background.

eg;
>* Skype
* Teamspeak
* Ventrillo
* Hamachi
* Spotify
* Anything that streams HD video content (i.e. Youtube, Twitch etc)
* Torrent programs (i.e. uTorrent)
* Active downloads (i.e Steam)

If your issue is still not resolved, you may want to contact your ISP and confirm there is nothing on their end that could be causing your issues (Although I doubt it by looking at that traceroute), or see if they're able to provide you additional solutions to your problem.

Hi SephirothSG,

Thanks so much for your reply. As of this morning when i read your post and changed my DNS back o my ISP's to run WinMTR, magically league of legends client was able to startup again. I guess my ISP side changed some settings in their dns servers because last night it was still unavailable. Nevertheless thank you so much for your reply and help summoner!

I ran my winMTR during lunch and this is the result. as for ICSI i didn't have java installed and since the issue isn't occuring anymore i didn't bother with running it.
